article.headline: Putin sends Trump a telegram offering 'sincere support' after positive coronavirus test
article.body: US President Donald Trump gives a thumbs up as he walks from Marine One after arriving on the South Lawn of the White House in Washington, DC, October 1, 2020, following campaign events in New Jersey. (Photo by SAUL LOEB / AFP) (Photo by SAUL LOEB/AFP via Getty Images) saul loeb/Agence France-Presse/Getty Images Russian President Vladimir Putin is extending wishes of a speedy recovery to U.S. President Donald Trump and his wife, Melania, and expressing "sincere support in this difficult moment," according to a statement released by the Kremlin on Friday. Trump announced on Twitter early Friday that he and first lady Melania Trump had tested positive for the coronavirus. iframe.twitter-tweet { width: 100% !important; } The Kremlin says Putin sent Trump a telegram saying, "I hope that your inherent vitality, good spirits and optimism will help you cope with the dangerous virus." See also: Markets, and analysts, seem unsure how to react to jarring news Trump has COVID-19 Other world leaders have reacted to President Trump's positive coronavirus test since the announcement. Vice President Pence and his wife Karen both tested negative for coronavirus on Friday morning.
